H0.text: Attract pollinators and make seeds are the two functions of flowers.

H1.text: Make seeds and store food are the two functions of flowers.

H2.text: Storing food and taking in water are functions of flowers.

H3.text: Take in water and attract pollinators are functions of flowers.

A4.text: Flowers provide bees with nectar (an energy source) and pollen (a source of protein).

A5.text: When a pollen grain adheres to the stigma of a carpel it germinates, developing a pollen tube that grows through the tissues of the style, entering the ovule through the micropyle. When the tube reaches the egg sac, two sperm cells pass through it into the female gametophyte and fertilisation takes place.
